did.head: Descriptive Summary

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Duke University Program in Film, Video, Digital

did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.
did.abstract: Records of the Program in Film/Video/Digital at Duke University include correspondence, subject files, schedules, publicity materials, and other items created or collected by the Film/Video/Digital program. Materials range in date from about 1988 to 2000.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the University Archives to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Copyright for Official University records is held by Duke University; all other copyright is retained by the authors of items in these papers, or their descendants, as stipulated by United States copyright law.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], in the Film, Video, Digital Program records, circa 1988-2000, Duke University Archives, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Finding aid derived from MARC record, November 2014

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Program in Film/Video/Digital, formerly the Program in Film and Video, is an interdisciplinary course of study that introduces students to the critical analysis of film, photography, and television in the context of cultural studies.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Records of the Program in Film/Video/Digital at Duke University include correspondence, subject files, schedules, publicity materials, and other items created or collected by the Film/Video/Digital program. Materials range in date from about 1988 to 2000.

note.label: General note
note.p: In off-site storage; 24 hours advance notice may be required for use.

note.label: General note
note.p: Unprocessed collection. Cataloged from accession records.

controlaccess.corpname: Duke University. Program in Film and Video
